description: Dive into "Whispers of Romance in Colmar" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Romance in Colmar

places.generalDescription: The Unterlinden Museum, located in a former 13th-century Dominican convent, is a captivating blend of religious and local history alongside an impressive art collection. One of its most renowned pieces is the Isenheim Altarpiece by Matthias Grunewald, known for its powerful depiction of Jesus' story and its historical significance as a source of solace for medieval hospital patients.

sources.snippet: Some of the main sites are the Maison Pfister, Saint Martin‚Äôs Church, the tall water tower and the Unterlinden Museum, one of the Alsace region‚Äôs top museums. Colmar has peaceful canals in the city center, stemming from the Lauch River. Located in the Alsace region of France, Colmar is known for wine trails and picturesque architecture, which are unique to the Alsatian part of France and the Bavarian region of Germany.
sources.shortName: Colmar, France ‚Äì the perfect honeymoon spot

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for a relaxing and culturally enriching night, start with a visit to the Unterlinden Museum, a former convent-turned-museum that holds an impressive collection of artwork, including the famous Isenheim Altarpiece. The museum often hosts late openings, allowing you to experience its art and history in a quieter, more intimate setting.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Colmar to experience the city like a local

sources.snippet: If you even remotely love art, then I highly recommend a visit to this museum. Housed in a Dominican convent, the Unterlinden features artwork from Medieval times to Monets. It‚Äôs most famous piece however, is Matthias Gr√ºnewald ‚Äòs beautiful Isenheim Altarpiece from the 16th century.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Colmar, France

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre into art, then the Unterlinden Museum is a must-visit in Colmar. This former convent-turned-museum houses an impressive collection of artworks from the Middle Ages to the 20th century. Its most famous piece is the Isenheim Altarpiece by Matthias Gr√ºnewald.
sources.shortName: 2 Days in Colmar: The Perfect Itinerary (from a Local)
One day in Colmar- things to do in the prettiest town in Alsace
15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: Unterlinden Museum

reviews.text: It was very positive... I was more keen this time on contemporary art works which are breathtaking and it invited me to humility... Yes, they speak much beyond what I understand now..

Try to came by here if you happen go to Colmar or the area around. The museum with remarkable architectuur and art collections. Is not as big as Louvre but it is worth a visit. Price ticket for adults ‚Ç¨13 per person.
Mid-sized museum with local artefacts, a famous painting (the Isenheim Altarpiece), and some modern art.

places.generalDescription: La Petite Venise in Colmar, France is a charming area known for its canals and historic buildings. The fisherman's section features half-timbered 16th- and 17th-century buildings along the Quai de la Poisonnerie, with the River Lauch flowing through. Swans gracefully float on the water while weeping willows line the banks, creating a picturesque scene reminiscent of a fairy tale illustration.

sources.snippet: The most famous ‚Äì and photographed ‚Äì spot in Colmar is La Petite Venise, which lives up to its highly renowned reputation. The water trickles quietly, the swans doze lazily and surrounding restaurants waft smells that can only be described as heavenly. The best part of Colmar is this famous bridge, which has flowers bursting from every banister, and rainbow colored half-timbered houses that give the Alsace region its charm.
sources.shortName: Colmar, France ‚Äì the perfect honeymoon spot

sources.snippet: But there‚Äôs more to Colmar than just the most photographed street in the La Petite Venise district that you see in all travel brochures and on social media‚Ä¶ The entire city center is gorgeous, with lively squares and a labyrinth of pretty streets lined with caf√©s and shops selling local specialties.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

sources.snippet: Little Venise is hands down one of the most beautiful places in Colmar. The Lauch river flows on either side of half timbered pastel colored houses with colorful flower pots cascading from their roofs. This place is a fairytale!.
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Colmar, France

places.name: La Petite Venise

reviews.text: We were very happy to travel here. The people are very friendly, the air is fresh, the environment is beautiful, and the travel experience was amazing. It's not overly commercialized. In early April, there aren't too many tourists, and with the great spring weather, it's easy to fall in love with this place without even realizing it. This romantic spot has, for hundreds of years, attracted many scholars, writers, and painters who came here in search of creative inspiration.

Colmar is a truly beautiful town - I absolutely loved it.
It's a perfect place for walking, relaxing, and simply soaking in the atmosphere.

You can enjoy some great local cafes and restaurants, or just sit by the canal and take in the refreshing vibe of the town.

Between the charming old buildings and peaceful natural surroundings, it offers a lovely and balanced experience. I think 3 days is enough to explore Colmar, but honestly, I wouldn't mind staying for 7‚Äì10 days - especially if you plan to visit nearby villages or cities in France or even Germany, since it's so close to the border.

Highly recommended for anyone looking for a peaceful and picturesque getaway.

Colmar is a magical fairy-tale town that you will be thrilled by. Parking is well organized, there are several marked parking lots and you can drive very close to the canal and park in the square, it was very busy, but we found a place. About 100 meters away is the canal restaurant, where you board the boat, tickets are sold in the restaurant. We waited about 20 minutes for our boat and so we had prosecco. I definitely recommend the cruise, it is a beautiful experience. You sail past historic houses lined with restaurants to the old market, which is definitely worth a visit, you can taste local specialties there. Behind the market, the boat turns and you sail back and further towards the historic bridge to the beautiful romantic corners of Colmar, like in Monet's paintings.

places.address: Quai de la Poissonnerie, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Coll√©giale Saint-Martin de Colmar is a grand Roman Catholic church that stands out with its Gothic architecture and medieval statues. Situated in the heart of the Old Town, it boasts a picturesque canal leading to its rear from Quartier des Tanneurs. The church, completed in the mid-1300s, features typical Gothic style with arched ceilings and stunning stained glass windows. Its intricate design includes a soaring Gothic choir and ornate decorative details.

sources.snippet: Next, take a short walk to Colmar Old Town and head towards Saint-Martin Cathedral. The cathedral is beautifully illuminated at night, and the surrounding area has a peaceful, almost reverent ambiance. Take a quiet moment to appreciate the Gothic architecture and the charm of the surrounding streets.
sources.shortName: Things to do at night in Colmar to experience the city like a local

sources.snippet: Also be sure to stop by the inspiring Saint Martin Church, a stunning 14th century church, and the nearby but much smaller Dominican Church, dating to the same time period.
sources.shortName: Colmar, One of France‚Äôs Most Beautiful Cities (Updated 2024)

places.name: Coll√©giale Saint-Martin de Colmar

reviews.text:
One of the beautiful churches I've seen. The peace that you feel when you're inside is surreal. The church is very well kept, although it's still under renovation, you can still see most of the old beauty.
The church during the golden hour were beautiful the walls and the structure of the building were glowing in the sunlight.

It is beautiful cathedral. The inner space is magic, with so strong atmosphere, and the outside is so impressive. The entrance is free but you can voluntarily give a few coins to the person standing in front of the door. What I would like to highlight is really pleasant fact that they take really good care of the building, it is all well-maintained and clean, leaving almost no black spots on it.

This is a large Gothic style church situated in the historic city centre of Colmar that I quite enjoyed seeing recently.

Historically, it seems there have been church buildings at this location since at least 1000 AD. However, the building you see today was constructed between 1234 and 1365.

It is a fine example of Alsace Gothic architecture from the Middle Ages and there are some nice things to see inside including original stained glass windows, choir ambulatory, altarpieces and Baroque era organ.

Worth 10 minutes of your time to browse the interior and a few more looking over the facade, towers, portals and other Gothic aspects of the exterior as well.

places.address: 18 Pl. de la Cath√©drale, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Maison Pfister is a stunning Renaissance town mansion located in Colmar, originally built in 1537 for Ludwig Scherer. The house is now named after Francois-Xavier Pfister, who acquired it in 1841. Colmar serves as an ideal base for exploring the medieval wine villages and towns nestled among the picturesque vineyards of the Vosges mountains.

sources.snippet: Some of the main sites are the Maison Pfister, Saint Martin‚Äôs Church, the tall water tower and the Unterlinden Museum, one of the Alsace region‚Äôs top museums. Colmar has peaceful canals in the city center, stemming from the Lauch River. Located in the Alsace region of France, Colmar is known for wine trails and picturesque architecture, which are unique to the Alsatian part of France and the Bavarian region of Germany.
sources.shortName: Colmar, France ‚Äì the perfect honeymoon spot

sources.snippet: Maison Pfister is one of the most famous buildings in Colmar. It was built in the 16th century for Ludwig Scherer. From there it changed hands several times before being bought by Fran√ßois Jean Pfister in the mid-19th century.
sources.shortName: 2 Days in Colmar: The Perfect Itinerary (from a Local)

places.name: Maison Pfister

reviews.text:
I came here on a recommendation I received in Strasbourg! A lovely lady spotted my Studio Ghibli tattoos and informed me that the inspiration for the initial town came from Colmar, so I just had to detour on my road trip to see for myself.

It's SO BEAUTIFUL, and the inspiration is very evident. The area itself had lovely street music going on and since I visited a week and a half before Easter it was beautifully decorated. Tons of markets in the area to explore.

ËøΩÂ∞ã„ÄäÈúçÁàæÁßªÂãïÂüéÂ†°„ÄãË£°ÁöÑÈ≠îÊ≥ïË∂≥Ë∑° üîÆ
Stepping into a fairytale! Built in the 1500s, this medieval-looking Alsatian house was commissioned by a wealthy hatter-just like Sophie, a hatter herself-though much poorer, of course... With its whimsical turrets, wooden balconies, and storybook charm, this place looks straight out of a magical adventure.
Can you picture Howl landing here with Calcifer's magic?

#HowlsMovingCastle #GhibliVibes #MedievalFantasy #FairytaleTravel #AlsatianTown
Old Pfister House, there are nice details on the building facade

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Le Quai 21 is a high-end dining spot in Colmar, offering inventive Italian-influenced Alsatian cuisine and an extensive wine selection in a stylish rustic-chic setting. Located just a short drive from the historic center of Colmar, it's an ideal base for exploring the Alsace region. The restaurant has garnered praise for its modern Alsatian dishes based on traditional recipes and offers an affordable set menu deal.

sources.snippet: Located in the district of Petite Venise in Colmar, the former restaurant Le Frichti‚Äôs has been replaced by the restaurant Le Quai 21. The atmosphere of the previous restaurant and the fine and seasonal cuisine are found here. After having had a crush on its predecessor, I must say that I was also really seduced by this one!
sources.shortName: ü•® My 11 best restaurant addresses in Colmar (2025)
Visit This Charming French Town For A Magical Couples Getaway

places.name: Restaurant Le Quai 21

reviews.text: A phenomenal dining experience. Each dish was delicious & full of flavor. The staff were knowledgeable & polite. I will definitely be back

We had reserved a table online and were warmly welcomed upon arrival. The restaurant is stylishly modern and impeccably clean. We really appreciated the upscale yet relaxed atmosphere ‚Äì refined without being overly formal. We each enjoyed a three-course √† la carte dinner, and every single dish was a delight. It's a wonderful fusion of traditional cuisine with a modern twist. From presentation to flavour to service ‚Äì everything was simply spot on. A top-notch dining experience that we'll happily repeat.

We went to this place based on the Michelin guide recommendation. The place was excellent. The food was creative, flavourful, and there was never ending bread which is quite rare nowadays.

We had the set menu. Without wine. It was very much worth the price. The bass was outstanding as was the dessert.

The only problem is that they were incredibly busy and therefore there was a long wait between dishes. Very long waits. And that brought down the rating. But if you have time to kill and talk. Then definitely worth coming here!

places.address: 15 Quai de la Poissonnerie, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Parc du Champ de Mars is a spacious and green park located in the heart of Colmar, offering a peaceful retreat with its tree-filled surroundings, fountain, and statues of notable French figures. Throughout the year, visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls, picnics, and even ice skating during winter. The park also hosts a charming Christmas market and festive activities during the holiday season.

sources.snippet: Located in the very heart of Colmar, this park called the ‚ÄúGreen Lung‚Äù lies between the Champ de Mars Boulevard (Boulevard Champ de Mars) and the Republic Avenue (Avenue de la R√©publique). Enjoy this pleasant haven of peace to stroll with your family or friends throughout the year. In winter, a skating rink is created there, as well as a Christmas market and Christmas animations.
sources.shortName: The 10 BEST things to do in Colmar ‚≠êÔ∏è 2025

sources.snippet: For a picnic in the park, head to Parc du Champ de Mars or spend a day renting bicycles and visiting surrounding wineries along the Alsace Wine Route. In town, visit the Choco Story museum, where you can learn about the history of chocolate, taste test samples, and even make your own chocolate bars.
sources.shortName: Visit This Charming French Town For A Magical Couples Getaway

places.name: Parc du Champ de Mars

reviews.text: My favorite little park so far. It is truly a friendly park for everyone. You can find people dancing, children playing with fountains, small dogs running happily and live blues if you're lucky! It makes you feel it's such a peaceful and beautiful world to live in!

Beautiful and huge park in the Center of the city near to the main train station. They do have a small playing place for the kids and a place for the coffee. It is good to have a short walk in the park. Well maintained and clean place. Green and peaceful to have a wonderful walk.
You can rest here and admire nature, flowers, birds and people...

places.address: Av. de la R√©publique, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Domaine Joseph Gruss & Son, a renowned winery in Alsace, offers an authentic wine-tasting experience. Visitors can savor the region's famous white wines like Gewurztraminer, Riesling, Pinot Gris, and Sylvaner in a charming setting. The estate's Cremant d'Alsace sparkling wines are also not to be missed. Guests are welcomed warmly and can sample a variety of wines without prior booking.

sources.snippet: The best-known white wines such as Gew√ºrztraminer**, Riesling, **Pinot Gris, Sylvaner,‚Ä¶ are traditionally served in a small round wine glass with a thin green stem. And be sure to also try Cr√©mant d‚ÄôAlsace, the sparkling wines of Alsace.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Colmar, France (+Map & Tips for Your Visit)

places.name: Domaine Joseph Gruss & Son (Fine Wines of Alsace)

reviews.text: Me and my wife have visited the J Gr√ºss & sons winery in Eguisheim perhaps ten times over the years. Very nice place with great wines - and most friendly family members and staff. We have never had to pay for the tasting, but of course we always bought a few boxes of wine to take home. Once Madame Gr√ºss handed us the key to their wine cellar and let us take a tour of our own! Love them and highly recommend a visit!
Another great winery, the hostess, was amazing and very friendly. While the wine wasn't our cup of tea, we enjoyed our experience. Tastings here are one Euro per glass.
Stunning wines and hospitality. We thank you for your time and giving us a greater understanding of the great wines of Alsace. We hope to see you in New Zealand for us to repay the hospitality.

places.generalDescription: Hotel Le Mar√©chal is a charming 4-star hotel built in the 1560s on the original fortifications of Colmar, nestled in the picturesque district of Little Venice. The individually decorated rooms offer a rustic-chic ambiance, and guests can enjoy a riverside restaurant serving traditional and regional gourmet cuisine. This pet-friendly hotel warmly welcomes dogs with special amenities and is conveniently located near Colmar's famous Christmas market and Place des Dominicains.

sources.snippet: Hostellerie Le Mar√©chal offers splendid rooms and suites in a heritage house dating back to the 1560s. pick this place for the sense of history, the gastronomic A l‚ÄôEchevin restaurant, and the appealingly central location. Perfect for couples, friends, foodies and history buffs.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Colmar, France

places.name: Hotel Le Mar√©chal

reviews.text:
Triple room is on top. Not handicapped accessible by any means but my kids and dogs enjoyed the climb to the top. Room was nice.
Locstion was good for walking and Luckly we found a parking spot in front so was convenient
My only complaint was the 20¬£ breakfast was not worth it. 150+ night a year in hotels around the world for the last 15 years and have good judge of breakfast.
It was barely equal to a free US hotel breakfast. I wouldn't have paid if I say it beforehand.

Outside of that, I'm happy for choosing the hotel and would again.

We really enjoyed our stay here even though it was cold and rainy. Loan (front desk concierge) was super knowledgable and helpful. Great customer service!
The restaurant is a must try. We were immediately seated once we arrived and the food/service was fantastic.
The location is perfectly placed. It's easily walkable to everything in Petite Venice.
The bar is great. Great cocktails, atmosphere and customer service.

We stayed in the ‚ÄúWagner‚Äù room and we like it very much. The room was  spacious and had a lovely view over the canal.Yes, the hotel is old(but full of charm) and there is no lift, however, we did not mind the stairs and we find it really clean. The breakfast was in a very nice veranda, not a very big variety of things, but enough.Coffee and croissants were good, they even offer the local sparkling wine.
What we did not like was that some noise was coming from the room upstairs, like opening drawers and walking, also the main door was a little hard to close and open(because of the carpet, i guess, and that made the handle a little flimsy).Also the lady at the reception could be a little more warm/smiley/friendly?she was very dry.

places.address: 4 Pl. des 6 Montagnes Noires, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Choco Story Colmar is an interactive chocolate museum in Colmar, offering several tastings during the visit. It's a fun activity for both kids and adults. In the Little Venice area, visitors can take a boat or gondola ride to float past fairytale houses and enjoy the blooming flowers. The museum provides a useful audio guide to explore the history of chocolate, from its origins as a spicy beverage to various candies and bars.

sources.shortName: One day in Colmar- things to do in the prettiest town in Alsace

sources.snippet: In town, visit the Choco Story museum, where you can learn about the history of chocolate, taste test samples, and even make your own chocolate bars.
sources.shortName: Visit This Charming French Town For A Magical Couples Getaway
15 Romantic Things to Do in Colmar, France

places.name: Choco Story Colmar

reviews.text: Was way better than I ever imagined. I learnt so much. It was interactive and fun - even for adults! Loved how well thought out it was. It was a really great experience. Don't rush it. Loved all the free chocolate samples to try (my husband loved that it was unmanned) üòÇ. A really great experience. You also get to try a hot chocolate at the end which was delicious !

This museum is a must see when in Colmar!
I highly recommend visiting here and you will learn a lot about the chocolate making process.

Fantastic, loved every part, my husband wanted to go round twice!! Very engaging, this is how a museum should be. Considering how much chocolate I eat it is amazing how little knowledge I had of where it comes from. We were 2 adults, but I can imagine children enjoying the interactivity and the games. And as an added bonus it was air conditioned, so we could escape the heat.

places.address: 12 Pl. de la Cath√©drale, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Wistub Brenner is a charming restaurant located in the heart of Petite Venise, known for serving up traditional Alsatian dishes using fresh, seasonal ingredients. The menu features specialties like bibalakas, an organic white cheese dish served with smoked ham, saut√©ed apples, and Munster cheese. The bistro offers a fine selection of local alcohol to complement the authentic cuisine.

sources.snippet: The first time I went to the Wistub Brenner, I was 18 years old and it was my first time in Alsace. Since then, I have grown up, I live in Colmar and the Wistub Brenner is the place where I bring my friends to taste good traditional Alsatian food. I have never been disappointed!
sources.shortName: ü•® My 11 best restaurant addresses in Colmar (2025)

places.name: WISTUB BRENNER

reviews.text: Good Alsatian restaurant, surprisingly not a tourist trap considering that it's located next to the canal, near to the bridge where everyone takes their photos. I would recommend outdoor seating since part of the appeal is its location. We had a good experience with food, wine, service and atmosphere.
Great service & good food! A bit more ‚Ç¨‚Ç¨ because of the tourist location but still very good menu price!

My wife and I had a great evening here. Besides the wonderful dishes we got (the pork knuckle and particularly the gigot d'agneau) the service was outstanding. Very welcoming and friendly. The interior is cozy and warm which is a great plus. Definitely recommended.

places.generalDescription: La Cocotte de Grand-M√®re is a charming bistro located in the heart of Colmar, offering robust French and Alsace dishes along with an extensive wine list. This cozy diner operates as a French bistro for lunch and dinner, attracting both locals and tourists. The restaurant prides itself on using fresh, seasonal ingredients to create homemade dishes that vary daily. Despite its small size, the restaurant exudes a comfortable vibe, providing an exclusive and cozy dining experience.

sources.snippet: La Cocotte de Grand-m√®re is a small restaurant offering French cuisine. All the products are fresh, seasonal and the dishes are home-made. The menu changes every day.
sources.shortName: ü•® My 11 best restaurant addresses in Colmar (2025)

places.name: La Cocotte de Grand-M√®re

reviews.text: Beautiful little Restaurant with a small menu. Thanks for the fantastic food and wine we will come again! Make a reservation upfront.

Very nice, well-presented food (focused menu) with excellent service and a great ambiance.

There's only one seating, maybe 7-8 tables, so no rush. Our server gave my mother excellent advice on what to drink with each course.
Food was delicious and service was very friendly.

places.generalDescription: La Maison des T√™tes - Relais & Ch√¢teaux - H√¥tel Colmar & Restaurants is a luxurious hotel located in a grand 17th-century mansion. It offers elegant rooms and suites, as well as fine dining options. The hotel stands out for its unique and carefully decorated rooms that blend modern furnishings with the historic charm of the building. With spacious accommodations, comfortable beds, and upscale bathrooms, it provides all the amenities needed for a relaxing stay after exploring Colmar's Christmas market.

sources.snippet: La Maison des T√™tes is a magical five-star hotel with exposed beams and sloping roofs. A sophisticated choice in Colmar, the hotel fuses its historic architecture with swish modern design. The highlight is the Michelin-starred Restaurant Girardin, where Chef Eric Girardin strives to craft pure and innovative dishes in a stark, white-on-white setting.
sources.shortName: Best places to stay in Colmar, France

places.name: La Maison des T√™tes - Relais & Ch√¢teaux - H√¥tel Colmar & Restaurants

reviews.text:
Maison des T√™tes in Colmar was an absolute delight! The hotel exudes charm and coziness, with its warm wooden beams and inviting d√©cor, including the white furry chairs that add a touch of hygge. Our spacious room was incredibly comfortable, and the large bathtub was perfect for unwinding.

Breakfast was a highlight, with sublime service and a delicious spread to start the day. The staff were exceptionally friendly and always ready to help, making our stay even more enjoyable. It's worth noting that the hotel offers parking, but be sure to reserve a spot in advance.

We also had the pleasure of dining at the hotel's restaurant, which was just as lovely as the rest of the experience. Maison des T√™tes is a true gem, and we can't recommend it enough!

Just checked out after a superb experience at the Maison des T√™tes. Husband and I booked three rooms for ourselves and our siblings family with two kids. The staff got us 3 rooms all next to each other which was excellent.

The staff are so friendly, warm, and helpful. The rooms were beautifully appointed with the most comfortable bed and pillows we've experienced in Europe. The to-go goodie bags were such a wonderful end to a truly 5 star stay.

Cannot recommend enough the adjoining patisserie. Stopped by 3 times in one day alone! The hotel breakfast was delicious as well. Was very cool to see all the fresh pastries being moved from the hotel kitchen to the patisserie in the morning.

Cannot wait to come back! Thank you for the wonderful time.

I had an amazing experience at La Maison des T√™tes in Colmar, thanks to Timoth√©e. He provided exceptional customer service, offering great wine recommendations with a friendly yet professional attitude. His expertise and warmth made our visit truly memorable. I highly recommend La Maison des T√™tes for anyone seeking a delightful and well-rounded dining experience.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Au Ko√Øfhus is a popular dining spot located near the Old Customs House in Colmar. The charming restaurant offers a cozy ambiance with traditional Alsatian decor and a lively atmosphere filled with appreciative tourists and locals. The menu features huge portions of regional standards along with changing specialties like coq au vin and choucroute "Colmarienne" with six different meats.
places.name: Restaurant Au Ko√Øfhus

reviews.text: The food was really tasty and the atmosphere was great. I highly recommend this restaurant.

The location of this restaurant is fantastic, just in the heart of Colmar. It is very cozy inside, decorated like the traditional Alps cabin. It has not such a long wait as other restaurants nearby but it was also full.

The tartes flambees are ok, but they came with  less ingredients than expected. The prices are average in the area.

The restaurant has w perfect location, really pleasant deco and atmosphere. The food was ok, bit nothing special. It was our first dinner in Colmar, after trying a couple more places I can say, there are better addresses to have traditional food. Mine, as well as my son's was just blend, gratin had a lot of fat and not a lot of taste. The burger also blend, no salt.
Good sweet though.

places.address: 2 Pl. de l'Ancienne Douane, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Wistub de la Petite Venise is a renowned establishment offering high-quality local cuisine and wine in a rustic dining setting. Similar to Strasbourg's Petite-France, Colmar's Petite Venise is a picturesque riverfront area with charming half-timbered buildings and canals lined with boats. Often referred to as the 'Beauty and the Beast' town, Colmar is believed to have inspired the setting of Belle's town in the famous film.

sources.snippet: Cosy little restaurant between La Petite Venise and Quai De La Poissonnerie serving traditional Alsatian food. The portions here were huge!
sources.shortName: Top Things to Do in Colmar, France

places.name: Wistub de la Petite Venise

reviews.text: Great restaurant for classic Alsatian cuisine. The dinning room is very cute, classic Alsatian decoration. Its very cozy and the food really was great. I would really recommend the pork leg and cheese salad since they are classics and they were prepared really really well. The escargots were also great, however you can have that basically anywhere in France.

A Wonderful Experience!
We stumbled upon this place by chance, and it turned out to be a truly pleasant surprise. Although we recommend making a reservation, we were seated right away. The staff was incredibly friendly and welcoming. The food was delicious, with huge portions that really satisfied us! They offered us unlimited bread and water without even asking. The atmosphere was magical ‚Äì traditional, warm, and exactly what you need to feel the charm of Alsace.

We are visiting from Greece, and this was one of the highlights of our trip!

We walked by while we were touring the Colmar, but decided to come back for a late lunch/early dinner to try some alsatian food. We were seated right away. There is an extra room upstairs. Very nice place full of an old artifacts, making unique atmosphere. The food was delicious and generous portion. You do not need a starter, in our opinion.  This place should be on your list while you are in Colmar. Fully recommended.

places.address: 4 Rue de la Poissonnerie, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of nature, Park Schoppenwihr is a tranquil botanical garden that invites visitors to immerse themselves in its lush landscapes. This enchanting space boasts towering trees, serene lakes, and sprawling meadows, making it an ideal spot for leisurely strolls or guided tours by appointment. As France's first organic botanical garden, it offers a unique experience for nature lovers.

sources.snippet: You can also take a walk in the romantic Schoppenwihr park, the first organic botanical garden in France, unless you prefer to take the Route des Cinq Ch√¢teaux (Route of the Five Castles), which includes the three castles of Haut-Eguisheim, Hohlandsbourg Castle and Pflixbourg Castle.
sources.shortName: Colmar Alsace, the historic town, Little Venice, the cuisine and wines

places.name: Park Schoppenwihr

reviews.text:
a must visit if somebody likes serenity nature
next to the city it is worth visiting specially with good weather
the ladies at the reception were so kind helpful and friendly
Beautiful gardens.  Walking paths.

Visited the grounds on several occasions for the garden festival open days. Most recently the 4th June. Beautiful in all the seasons..!
Love the place because the land scape is like an English Country Park in the style of Lancelot Capability Brown.
Home from home for me..!

places.generalDescription: Brasserie des Tanneurs is a charming country-style restaurant in Colmar, known for its traditional Alsatian dishes and whimsical vibe. It consists of two family-friendly restaurants, Brasserie des Tanneurs and Le Petit Tanneur, offering a cozy atmosphere and a kid-friendly menu. The rustic wooden decor makes it an ideal spot for capturing Instagram-worthy photos all year round.

sources.snippet: The restaurant Brasserie des Tanneurs has a very pretty storefront that you might want to capture for Instagram. The interior is also very cute with the wooden traditional decor!. It‚Äôs very popular among tourists so if you want to eat here, better book in advance or arrive early.
sources.shortName: The Best Instagram Spots in Colmar

places.name: Brasserie des Tanneurs

reviews.text: The food was very good. üòä both like the Alsace typical food and French. Sourcrow was very good and pork meat üçñ tasty ü§§. The fromage a la ch√®vre so exquisite

Very busy restaurant, with tables crammed together. We felt rushed and staff were under pressure coping with customers inside and the queues outside.
To be honest, food was ordinary with tarte flambes lacking in flavour.
I ate asortment of alsatian sausages with sauerkraut and potato. It was as good as it can be. Sauerkraut was fine and sausages were also tasty.

places.generalDescription: Restaurant Girardin, located at the site of La Maison des Tetes - Relais & Chateaux - Hotel Colmar & Restaurants, is a true haven of gastronomic peace. As soon as you step inside, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of lightness and timeless purity. The vegetarian tasting menu is a symphony of flavors and a feast for the eyes, offering a perfectly harmonized seasonal journey through the plant world.

sources.snippet: Within La Maison des T√™tes, you can visit Restaurant Girardin, which has gourmet authentic French cuisine made with seasonal local ingredients. Near the waterfront in Little Venice, try Le Quai 21 for a hint of Mediterranean influence.
sources.shortName: Visit This Charming French Town For A Magical Couples Getaway

places.name: Restaurant Girardin - 1 √©toile Michelin

reviews.text:
May 2023: Lucky enough to return for a second time - and had another lovely evening. Amazing food, wine, ambiance and care/attention to detail of the chef and all the staff.

August 2021: A wonderful place for dinner. Absolutely nothing to criticise! Sublime food.

Dining at a Michelin starred restaurant is often a dance, a carefully orchestrated ballet of flavors and presentation, and my evening at Restaurant Girardin in La Maison des T√™tes was no exception. Chef Eric Girardin's menu promised a ‚ÄúJourney to the Sensation World,‚Äù and while it delivered on that front, this marathon of a meal stretched into an epic 4 hours and 15 minutes, longer than I'd prefer to linger at any table.

We began our culinary odyssey with the Foie Gras. A rich and decadent start, pairing land and sea with a wild peach that added just the right touch of sweetness. It was a bold opener, and with the 2015 Trimbach Reserve Pinot Gris, it felt like the evening was off to a promising start.

Next up, Vegetal Painting, an artistic plate that captured the essence of the market, with vibrant colours and flavors that danced on the palate. Fresh, crisp, and a beautiful showcase of local produce, this dish was a testament to Girardin's eye for detail and balance.

The Trout followed, presented in two stages with a delicate sabayon of herbs. The trout was buttery and perfectly cooked, but by this point, the pacing was starting to feel a bit sluggish. Still, the flavors were undeniable, with each bite feeling more like a carefully composed melody than mere sustenance.

Artichokes came next, in a dish that could only be described as a textural exploration. Sublimated with a Riesling sauce and pearled with mint oil, it was a fresh and inventive course, though perhaps not the most memorable of the evening. It was a dish that might be better appreciated in a more focused setting rather than in the middle of a culinary marathon.

Then came the Beef, a grilled entrecote paired with a rustic millefeuille. The meat was tender, perfectly seasoned, mine was a little too medium, and the millefeuille added a satisfying texture. It was a solid course, if somewhat overshadowed by the sheer length of the meal.

The cheese course offered a choice between Munster ‚ÄúGonfl√©‚Äù, a dish featuring grapes, a hint of cumin, and Gew√ºrztraminer marc, or a Cheese Platter. I opted for the Munster, which was aromatic and packed with flavour, though by this time, my palate was beginning to tire.

For dessert, we had the option of Plums, sweet cinnamon and Gew√ºrztraminer, or the Kougelhopf, a delicate blend of vanilla and dried grapes. I went with the plums, which provided a sweet, comforting end to the meal. But as a final note, we were also sent off with an elegant block of chocolate and a few more desserts to take away, a thoughtful gesture, albeit one that felt a bit like overkill after such an extended dining experience.

By the end of the evening, the wine, the service, and the food all stood up to Michelin standards, but the duration of the meal took a toll on the overall experience. A 7-course meal should be a journey, not a marathon, and while I appreciated the artistry of each dish, the timing left something to be desired. It's a restaurant that knows how to impress, but I'd recommend pacing yourself, and perhaps opting for a shorter menu if you want to keep the night from stretching into the early hours.
Every dish was beautiful and innovative, the sommelier did not try to upsell us and recommended a grand cru Pfersigberg we loved. Honored to meet the chef too. Felt like a 2 star+ experience.

places.generalDescription: La Fleur de Sel is a charming bistro located in the heart of Petite Venise in Colmar, offering a delightful Alsatian dining experience with picturesque views of the canals. Despite its small size, the restaurant boasts a lovely waterfront terrace and an impressive array of local specialties. Some must-try dishes include flammekueche, bibeleskaes, tartiflette, and choucroute garnie.

sources.snippet: La Fleur de Sel is a restaurant located in the Petite Venise in Colmar. The room is very small, which gives it a very special atmosphere. Surprising at first but finally nice!.
sources.shortName: ü•® My 11 best restaurant addresses in Colmar (2025)

places.name: La Fleur de Sel

reviews.text:
While walking in the old town you come across this nice cafe with a terrace along the river. They have a good selection of small bites including cakes, bruschetta and ice creams and waffles.
They have a staffs are attentive and fast.
The location is great for its view of the city and river.
Price is not an issue here. Overall worthy of trying.

This is an Alsace eatery along Quai de la Poissonnerie in the heart of the Old Town of Colmar. We visited during the Christmas Market recently found them only open to serve take-away tartes flambee, pretzels, mulled wine and a few other drinks.

On the day, we tried their Munster (‚Ç¨7.50) which was small but decent size for one person. It was ready in less than 5 minutes. You can enjoy them at some standing tables available right next to the canal. Fit for purpose, good enough lite bites during the Christmas Market.

Such a cute place with tasty food!

The view from the terrace is stunning. Food really good.

Note that they only serve meals (flammkuchen) until 14:00, afterward only appetizers and desserts.

Additionally, no reservation is possible, so you might have to wait for a table when it is busy (definitely in high season).

places.address: 9 Quai de la Poissonnerie, 68000 Colmar, France

places.generalDescription: Picnic Kebab is a great place to get delicious kebabs. They have a wide selection of flavors and their food is always fresh. The staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable.

sources.snippet: Parc du Champs de Mars is a peaceful park, perfect for a romantic picnic. Pack a basket with local treats like fresh baguettes, cheeses, fruit, and, of course, a bottle of Alsace wine.
sources.shortName: 15 Romantic Things to Do in Colmar, France

places.name: Picnic Kebab

reviews.text: Polite staff and great taste food!

I'm from Istanbul and this is the closest and the best k√∂fte and pide that you can find here in France, let alone Colmar. The staff is very friendly and the prices are reasonable.
5/5 must try¬†¬´¬†Asiette K√∂fte¬†¬ª!
I ate a very delicious, abundant and satisfying menu (doner bread and potatoes). I definitely recommend it.
